meanings.definition: People who have an irrational fear or hatred of foreigners.
meanings.sent1: Some xenophobes refuse to interact with people from other countries.
meanings.sent2: The xenophobes in the town protested against the new immigrant community.
meanings.sent3: The xenophobes were so scared of foreigners that they avoided trying any foreign cuisine.
meanings.sent4: Her uncle was a xenophobe, seeing danger in every foreign face.
meanings.sent5: The xenophobes' fear of outsiders consumed their thoughts and actions.

meanings.definition: A person who is prejudiced against people from other countries.
meanings.sent1: The xenophobes at the meeting made derogatory comments about immigrants.
meanings.sent2: She realized her neighbor was a xenophobe when he refused to speak to their new foreign neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The xenophobes' fear of foreign languages led to comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: His hatred for foreigners turned him into a xenophobe, closing his mind to new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The xenophobes' prejudice against outsiders blinded them to the beauty of diversity.

meanings.definition: Those who exhibit hostility towards individuals who are different from themselves.
meanings.sent1: The xenophobes in the group always excluded anyone with different beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Xenophobes often react aggressively towards people of different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The xenophobes' fear of change made them act defensively towards new ideas.
meanings.sent4: Their xenophobic behavior made them the xenophobes of the community.
meanings.sent5: The xenophobes' hostility towards diversity created a toxic environment.
